intro: Guatteria schunkevigoi, commonly known as the Guatemalan guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly found in the highlands of Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments within montane forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
